00212 /*
00213 @endcode
00214 @page knobs Driver Tweaks
00215 This is a summary of device driver tweaks.
00216 -/sys/module/acq200_hostdrv/parameters/
00217  - acq200_debug_mbox\n
00218         set non-zero to debug mailbox transactions
00219  - acq200_hostdrv_debug\n
00220         set greater than zero to debug driver in general
00221  - acq200_stub_copy_to_user\n
00222         set non-zero for performance test [do not use]
00223  - acq200_use_interrupts\n
00224         set zero to disable interrupts [do not use]
00225  - slots\n
00226         maps logical device to CPCI slot#
00227 
00228 -/sys/class/acqX00/acq200.L/device/ \n
00229         where L is the logical device number 0..
00230  - available_input_channels
00231  - available_output_channels
00232  - cpci_slot
00233  - heartbeat\n
00234         non-zero value indicates "card is alive"
00235  - host_len\n
00236         host buffer length
00237  - host_pa\n
00238         host buffer physical [bus] address
00239  - interrupt_count
00240  - irq
00241  - pool
00242  - subsystem_device
00243  - subsystem_vendor
00244 
00245 
00246 @endpage
00247 <!-- /README --> */

00328 struct Acq200Device* acq200_lookupDevice(struct device *dev)
00329 {
00330         int id;
00331 
00332         for (id = 0; id < idx; ++id){
00333                 struct Acq200Device* acq200_device = devices[id];
00334                 if (dev == &devices[id]->pci_dev->dev){
00335                         return acq200_device;
00336                 }
00337         }
00338         
00339         return 0;
00340 }

00343 {

00345 
00346         for (id = 0; id < idx; ++id){
00347                 struct Acq200Device* acq200_device = devices[id];
00348                 if (dev == devices[id]->class_dev){
00349                         return acq200_device;
00350                 }
00351         }
00352         
00353         return 0;
00354 }

00359 static void get_max_buf(struct DmaBuf *dma_buf, int max_order)
00360 {
00361         void *buf;
00362         int order;
00363 
00364         for (order = max_order; order >= 0; --order){
00365                 buf = (void*)__get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL|__GFP_NOWARN, order);
00366                 if (buf){
00367                         dbg(1, "%2d [0x%08lx bytes] SUCCESS",
00368                                order, ORDER2LEN(order));
00369                         dma_buf->va = buf;
00370                         dma_buf->order = order;
00371                         return;
00372                 }else{
00373                         dbg(2, "%2d [0x%08lx bytes] FAIL",
00374                                order, ORDER2LEN(order));
00375                 }
00376         }
00377         assert(0);
00378 }
00379 
00380 static void alloc_max_buf(
00381         struct device *dev, 
00382         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf, 
00383         enum dma_data_direction dir,
00384         int max_order)
00385 {
00386         get_max_buf(dma_buf, max_order);
00387         dma_buf->pa = dma_map_single(
00388                         dev, dma_buf->va, dma_buf_len(dma_buf), dir);
00389 }

00396 static 
00397 struct Acq200Path *acq200_createPath(
00398         struct inode* inode, struct Acq200Device *device) 
00399 {
00400         struct Acq200Path *path = 
00401                 kmalloc(sizeof(struct Acq200Path), GFP_KERNEL);
00402 
00403         memset(path, 0, PATH_HEAD);
00404 
00405         if (path != 0){
00406                 path->device = device;
00407                 path->minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00408                 path->dma_buf = device->dma_buf;
00409                 init_waitqueue_head(&path->return_waitq);
00410         }
00411         return path;
00412 }
00413 
00414 static void acq200_deletePath(struct Acq200Path *path)
00415 {
00416         kfree(path);
00417 }
00418 static struct Acq200Device *acq200_lookup_device(struct inode* inode)
00419 {
00420         int major = MAJOR(inode->i_rdev);
00421         int isearch;
00422 
00423         dbg(2, "major %d", major);
00424 
00425         for (isearch = 0; isearch < idx; ++isearch){
00426                 struct Acq200Device* device = devices[isearch];
00427 
00428                 assert(device != 0);
00429 
00430                 if (device->ldev.major == major){
00431                         return device;
00432                 }
00433         }
00434 
00435         assert(0);
00436         return 0;
00437 }
00438 
00439 
00440 /* set a BIG timeout to handle case of timer ints disabled */
00441 #define BIGTIME 0x7fffffff   
00442 
00443 static int acq200_poll_response(
00444         struct Acq200Device* device, long timeout)
00445 {
00446         unsigned itimeout;
00447         unsigned mask = BP_CI_ACK;
00448         unsigned long end = jiffies + timeout;
00449 
00450         for (itimeout = 0; itimeout != BIGTIME; ++itimeout){
00451                 u32 ucommand = ioread32(&MBOX(device, BP_MB_COMMAND));
00452 
00453                 if ((ucommand&mask) != 0){
00454                         return 0;
00455                 }else{
00456                         if (itimeout < 4){
00457                                 dbg(2, "call to schedule STUBBED\n");
00458                         }else{
00459                                 schedule();
00460                         }
00461                 }
00462                 if (time_after(jiffies, end)){
00463                         break;
00464                 }
00465         }
00466  
00467         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00468 }
00469 
00470 static void fill_ramp(int *data, int len)
00471 {
00472         int ilen = len / sizeof(int);
00473         int ii;
00474         unsigned id = idx << 28;
00475 
00476         for (ii = 0; ii < ilen; ++ii){
00477                 data[ii] = id | ii;
00478         }
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00482 
00483 static struct Acq200Device *acq200_device_create(struct pci_dev *pci_dev)
00484 {
00485         struct Acq200Device *device =
00486                 kmalloc(sizeof(struct Acq200Device), GFP_KERNEL);
00487 
00488         assert(device);
00489         memset(device, 0, sizeof(struct Acq200Device));
00490         assert(idx < MAXDEV);
00491 
00492         devices[idx] = device;
00493         device->pci_dev = pci_dev;
00494         device->idx = idx++;
00495         sprintf(device->ldev.drv_name, "acq200.%d", device->idx );
00496 
00497         alloc_max_buf(&pci_dev->dev, &device->dma_buf, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL, 
00498                         COMMSBUF_ORDER);
00499         fill_ramp(device->dma_buf.va, dma_buf_len(&device->dma_buf));
00500 
00501         acq200_map_pci_memory(device);
00502 
00506         device->ram.va = device->dma_buf.va;
00507         device->ram.pa = device->dma_buf.pa;
00508 
00509         init_MUTEX(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00510         init_MUTEX(&device->clients.mutex);
00511         init_waitqueue_head(&device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00512         init_waitqueue_head(&device->m_dpd.aux_waitq);
00513         streamBufInit(&device->streambuf);
00514         tasklet_init(
00515                 &device->m_dpd.streaming_isr_tasklet, 
00516                 acq200_streaming_isr_bh, 
00517                 (unsigned long) device);
00518 
00519         rchInit(device, 0);
00520         acq200_pool_create(device);
00521         return device;
00522 }
00523 
00524 static void __kbuf_free(struct DmaBuf *dma_buf)
00525 {
00526         if (dma_buf->va != 0){
00527                 __free_pages(dma_buf->va, dma_buf->order);
00528         }
00529 }
00530 static void acq200_device_free(struct Acq200Device *device)
00531 {
00532         acq200_pool_delete(device);
00533         acq200_unmap_pci_memory(device);
00534 
00535         __kbuf_free(&device->dma_buf);
00536         __kbuf_free(&device->AB[0]);
00537         __kbuf_free(&device->AB[1]);
00538         kfree(device);
00539 }

00542 
00543 static ssize_t acq200_read (
00544         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00545 {
00546         char myline[80];
00547         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00548         int pos = (int)*posp;
00549 
00550         int len = sprintf(myline, "BIGBUF: pa=0x%08x len=0x%08lx\n",
00551                           device->dma_buf.pa, 
00552                           ORDER2LEN(device->dma_buf.order));
00553 
00554         if (pos < len){
00555                 int rc;
00556 
00557                 len = min((int)count, len - pos);
00558                 rc = copy_to_user(buf, myline + pos, len);
00559                 if (rc != 0){
00560                         err("returning EFAULT");
00561                         return -EFAULT;
00562                 }
00563                 *posp += len;
00564                 return len;
00565         }else{
00566                 return 0;
00567         }
00568 }
00569 
00570 static ssize_t acq200_write (
00571         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp)
00572 // write data as if from debug port
00573 {       
00574         dbg(1, "count %d", (int)count);
00575 
00576         return 0;
00577 }

00579 
00580 
00581 #define MBX_READ 1
00582 
00583 static void acq200_mbox_dbg(struct MailboxControl *mbc, int read)
00584 {
00585         u32* regs = read? mbc->mbxr: mbc->mbxw;
00586         unsigned mask = read? MBC_FROM_MBXR(mbc):  MBC_FROM_MBXW(mbc);
00587 
00588         info("%5s: [%x] %08x %08x %08x %08x", 
00589                 read? "READ": "WRITE",
00590                 mask,
00591              regs[0], regs[1], regs[2], regs[3]);
00592 }
00593 
00594 static int acq200_ioctl_read_mbox(
00595         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00596 {
00597         unsigned read_mask = MBC_FROM_MBXR(mbc);
00598         int ibox;
00599         
00600         for (ibox = MBOX_NUM; ibox-- > 0; ){
00601                 if (((1<<ibox)&read_mask) != 0){
00602                         mbc->mbxr[ibox] = MBOX_READ(device, ibox);
00603                 }
00604         }
00605 
00606         if (acq200_debug_mbox){
00607                 acq200_mbox_dbg(mbc, MBX_READ);
00608         }
00609 
00610         return 0;
00611 }
00612 
00613 static int _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(
00614         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00615 {
00616         unsigned write_mask = MBC_FROM_MBXW(mbc);
00617         int ibox;
00618 
00619         device->mbox_sync.response_received = 0;
00620 
00621         if (acq200_debug_mbox){
00622                 acq200_mbox_dbg(mbc, !MBX_READ);
00623         }
00624         for (ibox = MBOX_NUM; ibox-- > 0; ){
00625                 if (((1<<ibox)&write_mask) != 0){
00626                         MBOX_WRITE(device, ibox, mbc->mbxw[ibox]);
00627                 }
00628         }
00629         return 0;
00630 }
00631 
00632 #if 0
00633 static int acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(
00634         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00635 {
00636         if (down_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.mutex)){
00637                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00638         }
00639         _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(device, mbc);
00640 
00641         up(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00642         return 0;
00643 }
00644 #endif
00645 
00646 static int acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(
00647         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00649 {
00650         long timeout = mbc->mbc_flags&MBC_FLAGS_TO;
00651         int rc = 0;
00652 
00653         if (down_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.mutex)){
00654                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00655         }       
00656 
00657         _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(device, mbc);
00658 
00659         if (device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt){
00660                 if (timeout == MBC_FLAGS_TO_FOREVER){
00661                         rc = wait_event_interruptible(
00662                                 device->mbox_sync.waitq, 
00663                                 RESPONSE_RECEIVED(device));
00664                 }else{
00665                         rc = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00666                                 device->mbox_sync.waitq, 
00667                                 RESPONSE_RECEIVED(device),
00668                                 timeout);
00669                         if (rc == 0){
00670                                 rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
00671                         }else if (rc > 0){
00672                                 rc = 0;         /* ticks left == OK */
00673                         }
00674                 }
00675 
00676                 dbg(1, "back from wait rc:%d", rc);
00677         }else{
00678                 rc = acq200_poll_response(device, timeout);
00679         }
00680 
00681         acq200_ioctl_read_mbox(device, mbc);
00682         up(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00683 
00684         return rc;
00685         
00686 }
00687         
00688 
00689 static int acq200_mbox_ioctl(
00690         struct Acq200Device *device,
00691         unsigned long arg,
00692         int (*action)(struct Acq200Device *, struct MailboxControl *))
00693 {
00694         struct MailboxControl *umbc = (struct MailboxControl*)arg;
00695         struct MailboxControl kmbc;
00696         int rc;
00697 
00698         dbg(1, "01 action %p", action);
00699 
00700         rc = copy_from_user(&kmbc, umbc, sizeof(kmbc)); 
00701         if (rc != 0){
00702                 err("returning EFAULT");
00703                 return -EFAULT;
00704         }
00705 
00706         rc = action(device, &kmbc);
00707 
00708         rc = copy_to_user(umbc, &kmbc, sizeof(kmbc));
00709         if (rc != 0){
00710                 err("returning EFAULT");
00711                 return -EFAULT;
00712         }
00713 
00714         dbg(1, "99 ret %d", rc);
00715         return rc;
00716 }
00717 
00718 
00719 int acq200_ioctl (struct inode *inode, struct file *filp,
00720                         unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00721 {
00722         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(filp);
00723 
00724         dbg(1, "cmd 0x%08x", cmd);
00725 
00726         switch(cmd){
00727 
00728         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOR:
00729                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(device, arg, acq200_ioctl_read_mbox);
00730 #ifdef DANGEROUS
00731         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOW:
00732                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(device, arg, acq200_ioctl_write_mbox);
00733 #endif
00734         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOWR:
00735                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(device, arg, acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox);
00736         case ACQ32_IOG_PCIREGS_OFFSET: {
00737                 unsigned ba = device->csr.pa&(PAGE_SIZE-1);
00738                 ba += 0x10;
00739                 put_user(ba, (unsigned*)arg);         
00740                 return 0;
00741         }
00742         case ACQ32_IOS_INTS_DISABLE:
00743                 return acq200_intsDisable((unsigned)arg);       
00744         case ACQ32_IOS_INTS_ENABLE:
00745                 return acq200_intsEnable((unsigned)arg);
00746         default:                        
00747                 dbg(2, "wanted either 0x%08lx or 0x%08lx", 
00748                     (unsigned long)ACQ200_MBOX_IOR, 
00749                     (unsigned long)ACQ200_MBOX_IOWR);
00750                 return -ENOTTY;
00751         }
00752 }
00753 
00754 int acq200_sendCommand(struct Acq200Device *device, u32 command)
00756 {
00757         struct MailboxControl mbc = {
00758                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | MBC_TO_MBXW(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND) |
00759                 MBC_TO_MBXR(0xf)
00760         };
00761         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | BP_CI_DONE | BP_CI_COMMAND;
00762         return acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00763 }
00764 
00765 int acq200_sendCommandA3A4(
00766         struct Acq200Device *device, u32 command,
00767         u32 a3, u32 a4)
00769 {
00770         struct MailboxControl mbc = {
00771                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | 
00772                 MBC_TO_MBXW((1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)|(1<<BP_MB_A3)|(1<<BP_MB_A4)) |
00773                 MBC_TO_MBXR(0xf)
00774         };
00775         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | 
00776                 BP_CI_DONE | BP_CI_COMMAND | BP_MB_A3 | BP_MB_A4;
00777         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_A3] = a3;
00778         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_A4] = a4;
00779 
00780         return acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00781 }
00782 
00783 int acq200_sendQuery( 
00784     struct Acq200Device* device, 
00785     unsigned command, 
00786     unsigned* a1,
00787     unsigned* a2,
00788     unsigned* a3,
00789     unsigned* a4
00790     )
00792 {
00793         struct MailboxControl mbc = { 
00794                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | 
00795                 MBC_TO_MBXW(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)|
00796                 MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)
00797         };
00798         int rc;
00799 
00800         if (a3 != NULL_A3){
00801                 mbc.mbc_flags |= MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_A3);
00802         }
00803         if (a4 != NULL_A4){
00804                 mbc.mbc_flags |= MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_A4);
00805         }
00806 
00807         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | BP_CI_QUERY | BP_CI_DONE;
00808     
00809         rc = acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00810 
00811         if (rc == 0){
00812                 if (a1) *a1 = BP_GET_A1(mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_COMMAND]);
00813                 if (a2) *a2 = BP_GET_A2(mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_COMMAND]);
00814                 if (a3) *a3 = mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_A3];
00815                 if (a4) *a4 = mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_A4];
00816         }
00817 
00818         return rc;
00819 }
00820 
00821 
00822 
00823 int acq200_handle_incoming_message(struct Acq200Device *device)
00824 /* handle message - call from thread level */
00825 {
00826         u32 mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00827 
00828         dbg(1, "mfa %08x", mfa );
00829         if (mfa == 0xffffffff || mfa == 0){
00830                 return 0;
00831         }else{
00832                 device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count = 0;
00833 
00834                 acq200_consume_i2o(device, mfa);
00835                 return 1;
00836         }
00837 }
00838 
00839 
00840 irqreturn_t acq200_incoming_message_isr(struct Acq200Device *device)
00841 /* handle message - call from interrupt level */
00842 {
00843         u32 mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00844 
00845         dbg(1, "mfa %08x", mfa );
00846         /* get out of jail free trap */
00847         if (mfa == 0xffffffff || mfa == 0){
00848                 err("%d bad mfa 0x%08x", device->idx, mfa);
00849                 if (++device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count > BAD_MFA_THRESHOLD){
00850                         u32 mask = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OIMR));
00851                         mask |= ACQ200_OISR_OPQI;
00852                         writel(mask, CSR(device, ACQ200_OIMR));
00853                         err(" bad mfa 0x%08x masking ints to get back in game",
00854                             mfa);
00855                 }
00856                 return IRQ_NONE;
00857         }else{
00858                 device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count = 0;
00859                 acq200_consume_i2o(device, mfa);
00860                 return IRQ_HANDLED;
00861         }
00862 }
00863 
00864 
00865 static irqreturn_t acq200_doorbell_isr(
00866         struct Acq200Device *device, u32 doorbell)
00867 {
00868         dbg(1, "%s doorbell 0x%08x wakeup %p", 
00869             device->ldev.drv_name, doorbell, &device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00870 
00871         device->mbox_sync.response_received = 1;
00872         dbg(1, "about to wake up");
00873         wake_up_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00874         dbg(1, "wake done - do your worst");
00875         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00876 }
00877 
00878 static irqreturn_t acq200_isr(int irq, void* dev_id)
00879 {
00880         static int bad_report;
00881 
00882         struct Acq200Device* device = (struct Acq200Device*)dev_id;
00883         u32 status = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OISR));
00884 /* OIMR bits not interesting, and masked so not actually an interrupt */
00885 #define IRQ_IGNORE (ACQ200_OISR_OM_0|ACQ200_OISR_OM_1)
00886 
00887         if ((status & ~IRQ_IGNORE) == 0){
00888                 if ((status & IRQ_IGNORE) != 0){
00890                         writel(status,CSR(device, IRQ_IGNORE)); 
00891                 }
00892                 return IRQ_NONE;
00893         }else if (status&ACQ200_OISR_OPQI){ 
00894                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s", irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "message");
00895                 bad_report = 0;
00896                 device->interrupt_count[0]++;
00897                 return acq200_incoming_message_isr(device);
00898         }else if (status&ACQ200_OISR_ODI){
00899                 u32 doorbell = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_ODR));
00900 
00901                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s 0x%08x",
00902                     irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "doorbell", doorbell);
00903 
00904                 writel(doorbell, CSR(device, ACQ200_ODR));
00905                 bad_report = 0;
00906                 device->interrupt_count[1]++;
00907                 return acq200_doorbell_isr(device, doorbell);
00908         }else{ 
00909                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s", irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "bad");
00910                 if ((bad_report&0xffff) == 0){
00911                         err( "IRQ %d don't like this status 0x%08x", 
00912                              irq, status );
00913                 }
00914                 writel(status,CSR(device, ACQ200_OISR));
00915                 bad_report++;
00916                 device->interrupt_count[2]++;
00917                 return IRQ_HANDLED;
00918         }
00919 }
00920 
00921 #define MYTURN 1
00922 
00923 int acq200_onFirstClientOpenAB(struct Acq200Device *device)
00924 {
00925         int rc = 0;
00926 
00927         device->i2o_backstop =  kthread_run(
00928                 i2o_missed_int_checker, 
00929                 device, 
00930                 "acq200_i2o.%d", 
00931                 device->idx);
00932 
00933         return rc;
00934 }
00935 
00936 
00937 int acq200_onLastClientReleaseAB(struct Acq200Device *device)
00938 {
00939         int rc = 0;
00940         kthread_stop(device->i2o_backstop);
00941         return rc;
00942 }
00943 static int onOpen(struct Acq200Path *path)
00944 {
00945         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00946         int rc = 0;
00947 
00948         if (down_interruptible(&device->clients.mutex)){
00949                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00950         }
00951         if (++device->clients.count == 1){
00952                 rc = acq200_onFirstClientOpenAB(device);
00953         }
00954         up(&device->clients.mutex);
00955 
00956         return rc;      
00957 }
00958 
00959 static int onRelease(struct Acq200Path *path)
00960 {
00961         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00962         int rc = 0;
00963 
00964         dbg(1, "into critical ...");
00965         if (down_interruptible(&device->clients.mutex)){
00966                 err("possible corrupt mutex on interruption");
00967         }
00968         if (device->clients.count == 1){
00969                 rc = acq200_onLastClientReleaseAB(device);
00970         }
00971         --device->clients.count;
00972         up(&device->clients.mutex);
00973 
00974         dbg(1, "clients.count %d", device->clients.count);
00975         return rc;      
00976 }
00977 
00978 
00979 
00980 int acq200_bridge_openAB(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00981 {
00982         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00983         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00984 
00985         if (device->AB[0].va == 0){
00986                 struct device *dev = &device->pci_dev->dev;
00987                 /* allocate buffer A, buffer B */
00988                 alloc_max_buf(dev, &device->AB[0], DMA_FROM_DEVICE, 
00989                                 acq200_AB_dmabuf_max_order);
00990                 alloc_max_buf(dev, &device->AB[1], DMA_FROM_DEVICE,
00991                                 acq200_AB_dmabuf_max_order);
00992         }
00993 
00994         copyDmaBuf2IoMapping(&path->bufferMappings[0], &device->AB[0]);
00995         copyDmaBuf2IoMapping(&path->bufferMappings[1], &device->AB[1]);
00996         onOpen(PD(file));
00997         return 0;
00998 }
00999 int acq200_bridge_releaseAB (
01000         struct inode *inode, struct file *file
01001         )
01002 {
01003         onRelease(PD(file));
01004         if (acq200_AB_quick_release){
01005                 return 0;
01006         }else{
01007                 return acq200_bridge_release(inode, file);
01008         }
01009 }
01010 
01011 int acq200_ioctlAB (struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
01012                         unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
01013 {
01014         dbg(1, "cmd %d valid %lu", cmd, (unsigned long)ACQ200_BUFFER_AB_IOWR);
01015 
01016         switch(cmd){
01017         case ACQ200_BUFFER_AB_IOWR: {
01018                 struct BufferAB_Ops ab_ops;
01019                 int rc;
01020 
01021                 COPY_FROM_USER(&ab_ops, (void*)arg, BUFFERAB_OPS_SZ);
01022                 rc = acq200_bufferABaction(file, &ab_ops);
01023                 if (rc == 0){
01024                         COPY_TO_USER((void*)arg, &ab_ops, BUFFERAB_OPS_SZ);
01025                 }
01026                 return rc;
01027         }
01028         default:
01029                 return -ENOTTY;
01030         }
01031 }
01032 
01033 
01034 int acq200_open (struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01035 {
01036         static struct file_operations acq200_fops = {
01037                 .read = acq200_read,
01038                 .write = acq200_write,
01039                 .release = acq200_release,
01040                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01041                 .mmap = acq200_mmap_host
01042         };
01043         static struct file_operations acq200_mbox_fops = {
01044                 .read = acq200_read,
01045                 .write = acq200_write,
01046                 .release = acq200_release,
01047                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01048                 .mmap = acq200_mmap_mbox
01049         };
01050         static struct file_operations acq200_bridge_fops = {
01051                 .read = acq200_bridge_read,
01052                 .write = acq200_bridge_write,
01053                 .release = acq200_bridge_release
01054         };
01055         static struct file_operations acq200_bridge_AB_fops = {
01056                 .open = acq200_bridge_openAB,
01057                 .read = acq200_bridge_readAB,
01058                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctlAB,
01059                 .mmap = acq200_mmapAB,
01060                 .write = acq200_bridge_write,
01061                 .release = acq200_bridge_releaseAB
01062         };
01063 #define RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(newfops)                    \
01064         file->f_op = &newfops;                          \
01065         if (newfops.open != 0){                         \
01066                 return newfops.open(inode, file);       \
01067         }else{                                          \
01068                 return 0;                               \
01069         }
01070 
01071         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookup_device(inode);
01072         struct Acq200Path *path;
01073 
01074         dbg(1, "01");
01075 
01076         if (device == 0){
01077                 return -ENODEV;
01078         }
01079 
01080         path = acq200_createPath(inode, device);
01081         SET_PATH(file, path);
01082 
01083         if (DEVRAW(path->minor)){
01084                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_mbox_fops);
01085         }else if (BIGDUMPDEV(path->minor)){
01086                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_fops);
01087         }else if (IS_CHANNEL_DEV(path->minor)){
01088                 if (path->minor > 96){
01089                         RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_AB_fops);
01090                 }else{
01091                         RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01092                 }
01093         }else if (IS_FILE(path->minor)){
01094                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01095         }else if (IS_RSH(path->minor)){
01096                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01097         }else{
01098                 /* placeholder */
01099                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_fops);
01100         }
01101 
01102         return -ENODEV;
01103 }
01104 
01105 int acq200_release (struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01106 {
01107         acq200_deletePath(PD(file));
01108         dbg(1, "01");
01109         return 0;
01110 }
01111 
01112 
01113 static int __devinit
01114 acq200_device_init(struct Acq200Device *device)
01115 {
01116         static struct file_operations acq200_default_fops = {
01117                 .open = acq200_open,
01118                 .release = acq200_release,
01119                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01120         };
01121         int rc;
01122 
01123 
01124         rc = pci_enable_device(device->pci_dev);
01125         if (rc != 0){
01126                 err("pci_enable_device FAILED returning %d", rc);
01127                 return rc;
01128         }
01129 
01130         slots[device->idx] = acq200_get_cpci_slot(device->pci_dev);
01131         
01132         rc = register_chrdev(device->ldev.major = 0, 
01133                              device->ldev.drv_name, 
01134                              &acq200_default_fops);
01135 
01136         if (rc < 0){
01137                 err( "can't get major %d", device->ldev.major );
01138                 return rc;
01139         }else{
01140                 device->ldev.major = rc;
01141                 info( "device major set %d\n", device->ldev.major );
01142         }
01143 
01144 /*
01145  * if interrupts are requested globally, AND the board is wanting an interrupt,
01146  * ask Linux for the use thereof
01147  */
01148         if (acq200_use_interrupts != 0 && device->pci_dev->irq != 0){
01149                 rc = request_irq( 
01150                         device->pci_dev->irq, 
01151                         acq200_isr, 
01152                         IRQF_SHARED,
01153                         device->ldev.drv_name, 
01154                         device
01155                 );
01156 
01157                 if (rc != 0){
01158                         err("request_irq %d FAILED", device->pci_dev->irq);
01159                         return rc;
01160                 }
01161         }
01162 
01163         if (device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt){
01164                 rc = acq200_sendCommand(device, 
01165                            BP_SET_FUNCODE(BP_FC_SET_INTERRUPTS)+BP_SET_A1(3));
01166                 if (rc != 0){
01167                         err("BP_FC_SET_INTERRUPTS failed %d", rc);
01168                         return rc;
01169                 }
01170         }
01171 
01172         if (device->completed_onetime_setups == 0){
01173                 unsigned funcode = 
01174                         BP_SET_FUNCODE(BP_FC_SET_HOST_DMABUF)|
01175                         BP_SET_A1(NMAPPINGS);
01176                 rc = acq200_sendCommandA3A4(device,
01177                         funcode,
01178                         (u32)device->dma_buf.pa, 
01179                         dma_buf_len(&device->dma_buf));
01180                 device->completed_onetime_setups = 1;
01181 
01182                 if (rc != 0){   
01183                         err("BP_FC_SET_HOST_DMABUF failed %d", rc);
01184                         return rc;
01185                 }
01186 
01187                 rc = acq200_getAvailableChannels(device);
01188         }
01189 
01190 
01191         acq200_create_sysfs_device(&device->pci_dev->dev);
01192 
01193         device->class_dev = CLASS_DEVICE_CREATE(
01194                 acq200_device_class,                    /* cls */
01195                 NULL,                                   /* cls_parent */
01196                 device->idx,                            /* "devt" */
01197                 &device->pci_dev->dev,                  /* device */
01198                 "acq200.%d", device->idx);               /* fmt, idx */
01199 
01200         acq200_create_sysfs_class(device->class_dev);
01201         /* create a symlink for the device */
01202         rc = sysfs_create_link(&device->class_dev->kobj, &device->pci_dev->dev.kobj,
01203                                 "device");
01204         if (rc) {
01205                 err("failed to create symlink %s\n", "device");
01206         }       
01207 
01208         return rc;      
01209 }
01210 
01211 
01212 static void acq200_set_dev_type(
01213         struct Acq200Device* device, const struct pci_device_id *ent)
01214 {
01215         if (IS_ACQ196(ent)){
01216                 device->card_type = DEV_TYPE_ACQ196;
01217                 sprintf(device->model_name, "%s", "acq196");
01218         }else{
01219                 device->card_type = DEV_TYPE_ACQ216;
01220                 sprintf(device->model_name, "%s", "acq216");
01221         }
01222 }
01223 
01224 
01225 static int __devinit
01226 acq200_probe(struct pci_dev *dev, const struct pci_device_id *ent)
01227 {
01228         struct Acq200Device* device = acq200_device_create(dev);
01229 
01230         acq200_set_dev_type(device, ent);
01231         return acq200_device_init(device);
01232 }
01233 
01234 
01235 static void acq200_remove (struct pci_dev *dev)
01236 {
01237         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(&dev->dev);
01238         if (device != 0){
01239 
01240                 int used_interrupts = device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt != 0;
01241 
01242                 if (used_interrupts){
01243                         free_irq(device->pci_dev->irq, device);
01244                         device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt = 0;
01245                 }
01246 
01247                 dbg(1, "free_irq %s", used_interrupts? "YES": "NO");
01248 
01249                 acq200_remove_sysfs_class(device->class_dev);
01250                 acq200_remove_sysfs_device(&device->pci_dev->dev);
01251                 device_destroy(acq200_device_class, device->idx);
01252 
01253                 unregister_chrdev(
01254                                 device->ldev.major, device->ldev.drv_name);
01255                 acq200_device_free(device);
01256         }
01257 }
01258 
01259 
01260 /*
01261  *
01262  * { Vendor ID, Device ID, SubVendor ID, SubDevice ID,
01263  *   Class, Class Mask, String Index }
01264  */
01265 static struct pci_device_id acq200_pci_tbl[] __devinitdata = {
01266         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_HINT, 0x0029, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01267         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, 0x0318, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01268         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, 0x0319, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01269         { }
01270 };
01271 static struct pci_driver acq200_driver = {
01272         .name     = acq200_driver_name,
01273         .id_table = acq200_pci_tbl,
01274         .probe    = acq200_probe,
01275         .remove   = __devexit_p(acq200_remove),
01276 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
01277         /* Power Managment Hooks */
01278 #ifdef CONFIG_PM
01279         .suspend  = acq200_suspend,
01280         .resume   = acq200_resume
01281 #endif
01282 #endif
01283 };

01288 static int __init acq200_init( void )
01289 {
01290         int rc;
01291 
01292         acq200_device_class = class_create(THIS_MODULE, "acqX00");
01293         rc = pci_register_driver(&acq200_driver);
01294         dbg(1, "pci_register_driver() returned %d", rc );
01295         return 0;
01296 }
01297 
01298 int acq200_init_module(void)
01299 {
01300         info("%s\n%s\n%s\n%s", 
01301              acq200_driver_name, acq200__driver_string,
01302              acq200__driver_version, acq200__copyright);
01303         acq200_init();
01304         return 0;
01305 }
01306 
01307 void acq200_exit_module(void)
01308 {
01309         if (!idx) return;
01310         pci_unregister_driver(&acq200_driver);
01311         class_destroy(acq200_device_class);
01312 }

01316 module_exit(acq200_exit_module);
